It's an interesting mix of survival-horror and FPS, at least in the first half when you're simply trying to escape Black Mesa. It holds up pretty decently here in 2021 given its vintage. Valve practically gives this game away for free these days with it being so cheap even when not on sale for $2 or whatever. Still worth checking out, but it might not be for everyone as, while I feel like it's not too hard to slip back into not everyone is ready for a game from 1998.

I highly recommend this, for multiple reasons:
1. Even though it shows its age, it still has a story that is better than most games out there today.

2. The game is fun to play as you battle your way through the Black Mesa Facility solving puzzles and killing Aliens and Military personnel.

3. A ton of thought and care was put into this game making it one of if not the greatest FPS of all time.

4. It was created by Valve so even more care was put in it.
Its a great classic, and it still is worth playing, it has an incredible story and a unique feel you should play it!
The game is good. Havent seen my family in 4.2 hours. I'm addicted. Better than Half Life 2
